alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Bullock; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 4:42PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Pike, southwestern Bullock, southeastern Montgomery and southwestern Barbour Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 442 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pike Road to near Blue Springs State Park. Movement was southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Brundidge, Clio, Banks, Blue Springs, Pine Level, Beans Crossroads, Linwood, Shopton, Doster, Antioch, Troy Municipal Airport, Troy University, Tennille, High Ridge, Carters Hill, Josie, Currys, Tanyard and Hamilton Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
